Doc: An event representing the fact that a new loan contract (funded borrowing) has been requested by the borrower.

Source.Contents:
/#
   An event representing the fact that a new loan contract (funded borrowing) has been requested by the borrower.
 #/
record FpML5.confirmation.Borrowing {
  eventIdentifier : FpML5.confirmation.BusinessEventIdentifier

  # An identifier used to group related business events together.
  businessEventGroupId : FpML5.confirmation.BusinessEventGroupIdentifier?

  # A unique id associated with a previous inaccurate event. Population of this identifier reflects the fact that this new event is being used to apply a 'corrective measure' to the referenced event (rather than this being an actual real-life event). The net result (across both events) ensures accurate accounting.
  previousInaccurateEventId : FpML5.confirmation.BusinessEventIdentifier?

  # A reference to the agent bank for the associated deal.
  agentPartyReference : FpML5.confirmation.PartyReference?

  # A reference to the main borrower associated with the specific business event.
  borrowerPartyReference : FpML5.confirmation.PartyReference?

  # The date on which the associated business event is effective.
  effectiveDate : date

  # A reference to the lender associated with a specific business event.
  lenderPartyReference : FpML5.confirmation.PartyReference

  # Defines the overall net cash payable, as well as, the breakdown of individual cashflows.
  cashPayable : FpML5.confirmation.CashPayable?

  # A freetext field which allows the sender to add further details around the business event.
  comment : string?

  loanContractReference : FpML5.confirmation.LoanContractReference

  amount : FpML5.confirmation.MoneyWithParticipantShare

  # An enumeration which describes whether the condition precent have been met, not met or been waived. Please note: this field in not required since conditions precedent may not be applicable in certain scenarios.
  conditionsPrecedentMet : string?

}

businessEventGroupId.Doc: An identifier used to group related business events together.
businessEventGroupId.Name: businessEventGroupId

previousInaccurateEventId.Doc: A unique id associated with a previous inaccurate event. Population of this identifier reflects the fact that this new event is being used to apply a 'corrective measure' to the referenced event (rather than this being an actual real-life event). The net result (across both events) ensures accurate accounting.
previousInaccurateEventId.Name: previousInaccurateEventId

agentPartyReference.Doc: A reference to the agent bank for the associated deal.
agentPartyReference.Name: agentPartyReference

borrowerPartyReference.Doc: A reference to the main borrower associated with the specific business event.
borrowerPartyReference.Name: borrowerPartyReference

effectiveDate.Doc: The date on which the associated business event is effective.
effectiveDate.Name: effectiveDate

lenderPartyReference.Doc: A reference to the lender associated with a specific business event.
lenderPartyReference.Name: lenderPartyReference

cashPayable.Doc: Defines the overall net cash payable, as well as, the breakdown of individual cashflows.
cashPayable.Name: cashPayable

comment.Doc: A freetext field which allows the sender to add further details around the business event.
comment.Name: comment

conditionsPrecedentMet.Doc: An enumeration which describes whether the condition precent have been met, not met or been waived. Please note: this field in not required since conditions precedent may not be applicable in certain scenarios.
conditionsPrecedentMet.Name: conditionsPrecedentMet
